intro: Coprosma tenuifolia, commonly known as silver coprosma, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, often silver-tinged leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes. It is typically found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Coprosma tenuifolia is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to form dense, evergreen shrubs.
